verses.kjv: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
verses.ct: I have placed my trust in the LORD. So why do you tell me, 'Run away to the mountains like a bird'?

verses.kjv: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
verses.ct: Look — evil people are drawing their bows, fitting their arrows to the string, ready to shoot from the shadows at those whose hearts are honest.

verses.kjv: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
verses.ct: When the foundations of society are torn apart, what can those who do right even do?

verses.kjv: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
verses.ct: The LORD is in his holy temple; the LORD's throne is in heaven. His eyes watch closely, and he examines every human being.

verses.kjv: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
verses.ct: The LORD tests those who do right, but he despises the wicked and anyone who loves violence.

verses.kjv: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
verses.ct: He will pour down burning coals, fire, and sulfur on the wicked, along with a scorching wind — that is what they will get.

verses.kjv: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
verses.ct: The LORD is righteous and loves righteousness; those who live with integrity will see his face with favor.
